item.title: Learning Python
item.description: During the last few weeks of SDS348, we have been learning some of the basics of Python. While my first instinct was to stick to what I know best (R), Python has proven itself to be pretty interesting and versatile, although I will have to put a lot more work into it before I start feeling more comfortable. There are quite a few differences between R and Python, but two of the most basic differences come across when indexing in either program and when you come across a type of dataframe called a dictionary.
